---
date: '2025-05-26'
published_time: 2025-05-26 18:09:08-04:00
source_url: https://www.whitehouse.gov/articles/2025/05/president-trump-honors-americas-heroes-on-memorial-day/
tags: articles
title: "President Trump Honors America\u2019s Heroes on Memorial Day"
---
 
Today, on Memorial Day, President Donald J. Trump joined Gold Star
Families, servicemembers, and members of his administration at Arlington
National Cemetery to pay tribute to the fallen heroes whose sacrifice
has kept our nation free.

<figure>
<img
src="https://www.whitehouse.gov/wp-content/uploads/2025/05/P20250526DT-0131.jpg"
style="width:800px" decoding="async" data-fetchpriority="high"
sizes="(max-width: 3000px) 100vw, 3000px"
srcset="https://www.whitehouse.gov/wp-content/uploads/2025/05/P20250526DT-0131.jpg 3000w, https://www.whitehouse.gov/wp-content/uploads/2025/05/P20250526DT-0131.jpg?resize=600,400 600w, https://www.whitehouse.gov/wp-content/uploads/2025/05/P20250526DT-0131.jpg?resize=768,512 768w, https://www.whitehouse.gov/wp-content/uploads/2025/05/P20250526DT-0131.jpg?resize=1200,800 1200w, https://www.whitehouse.gov/wp-content/uploads/2025/05/P20250526DT-0131.jpg?resize=1536,1024 1536w, https://www.whitehouse.gov/wp-content/uploads/2025/05/P20250526DT-0131.jpg?resize=2048,1365 2048w"
width="3000" height="2000"
alt="President Donald Trump, Vice President JD Vance, and Secretary of Defense Pete Hegseth participate in a wreath-laying ceremony at the Tomb of the Unknown Soldier on Memorial Day, Monday, May 26, 2026, at Arlington National Cemetery in Arlington, Virginia. (Official White House Photo by Daniel Torok)" />
<img
src="data:image/svg+xml;base64," />
</figure>

**Here are the highlights:**

-   “In every hour of peril and every moment of crisis, American
    warriors have left behind the blessings of home and family to answer
    their nation’s call. They’ve offered all that they had within them
    and given their last breaths to each and every one of us — that we
    might live safe and breathe free.”
    [***Watch***](https://x.com/RapidResponse47/status/1927037418642796638)  
-   “The sacrifice that they made was not merely for a single battle, a
    long-ago victory, or a fleeting triumph decades or centuries past.
    Their sacrifice was for today, tomorrow, and every morning
    thereafter.”
    [***Watch***](https://x.com/RapidResponse47/status/1927040449367167400)  
-   “Every child that lives in peace, every home that is filled with joy
    and love, every day the Republic stands, is only possible because of
    those who did what had to be done when duty called … Our debt to
    them is eternal and it does not diminish with time; it only grows
    and grows and grows with each passing year. The greatest monument to
    their courage is not carved in marble or cast in bronze — it’s all
    around us, an American nation 325 million strong, which will soon be
    greater than it has ever been before.”
    [***Watch***](https://x.com/RapidResponse47/status/1927040449367167400)  
-   “Great poets have written that it’s love which moves the sun and the
    stars. But here on the sacred soil — right where we are — we’re
    reminded that it’s love which moves the course of history, and moves
    it always toward freedom. Always.”
    [***Watch***](https://x.com/RapidResponse47/status/1927039625014509882)  
-   “From Bunker Hill to Bastogne to Cantigny to Coral Sea, from
    Gettysburg to Guadalcanal, and Concord to Kabul, America’s best and
    America’s bravest have fought, bled, and died so that we could pick
    up the torch of liberty, raise it high, high, high, and carry it
    onward.”
    [***Watch***](https://x.com/RapidResponse47/status/1927040175604961335)  
-   “In every generation since, at Trenton and Yorktown, at Vicksburg
    and Shiloh, and in faraway places with names like Château-Thierry,
    Anzio, Iwo Jima, Khe Sanh, Kandahar … They plunged into the crucible
    of battle, stormed into the fires of hell, charged into the valley
    of death, and rose into the arms of angels.”
    *[**Watch**](https://x.com/RapidResponse47/status/1927037405137105307)*  
-   **Vice President JD Vance:** “Consider the sum of all the moments
    that make a good life, and now appreciate how countless strangers,
    people most of you never met, they gave up those moments in their
    own life so that we could enjoy them in ours, and that is what
    Memorial Day is all about … To them, we owe everything — and today,
    in the peace they bequeathed to us, we honor them.”
    *[**Watch**](https://x.com/RapidResponse47/status/1927037112899047683)*  
-   **Secretary of Defense Pete Hegseth:** “This is the story of the
    unknown — the story of the fallen soldier who we have gathered today
    to honor. It is the story of the American warrior. He answered the
    call, fought, and died for this Republic; the ultimate sacrifice of
    a free people.”
    *[**Watch**](https://x.com/RapidResponse47/status/1927033647426678795)*  
-   **Chairman of the Joint Chiefs of Staff General Dan Caine:** “It’s
    in the lives of the fallen and their families that we’re left a
    standard to live by — a charge for us all to keep, a charge to carry
    the torch forward with duty, courage, and love of country.”
    *[**Watch**](https://x.com/RapidResponse47/status/1927031566510788706)*
